unnormalised: So, the IPL final happened, right? Let's talk numbers. Not the nail-biting, edge-of-your-seat kind of numbers, but the kind that make your head spin faster than a Bumrah yorker. I mean, we’re looking at some truly impressive stats, some utterly baffling ones, and some that are just plain… weird.
normalised: So, the I-P-L final happened, right? Let's talk numbers. Not the nail-biting, edge-of-your-seat kind of numbers, but the kind that make your head spin faster than a Bumrah yorker. I mean, we’re looking at some truly impressive stats, some utterly baffling ones, and some that are just plain… weird.

unnormalised: First off, let's give it up for the winning team, who achieved a target of 180 runs. One hundred and eighty. Sounds simple enough, but consider the calculations that went into every single run. The angles, the bat speed, the gravitational pull of my chai cup as I watched from the sofa… pure physics, people. My brain hurts.

unnormalised: Then there's the over rate. Did the commentators mention it? Maybe. Did I understand it? Absolutely not. But hey, numbers!

unnormalised: But my favorite number has to be the attendance figure. Over 65,000 people packed into that stadium, roaring, cheering, and presumably spilling their own chai. Or maybe just the excuse to scream at the top of their lungs on a Sunday evening. Who am I to judge?
